content:
User: No, its not in C: root, it is in the AI-Execution-System folder

Gemini: You are right, if firebase_key.json is located in the C:\AI-Execution-System\ folder, then the key_path in your Python script needs to be updated to:

key_path = r'C:\AI-Execution-System\firebase_key.json'  # <--- CORRECTED PATH
Action for You Now:

Update key_path in Script: Open your firestore_upload_script.py file and change the line defining key_path to the corrected path shown above:

key_path = r'C:\AI-Execution-System\firebase_key.json'
Make sure it is exactly this path, using the raw string r'...' and the correct folder name AI-Execution-System.

Save the Script: Save the updated firestore_upload_script.py file.

Rerun the Python Script: Go to your command prompt and execute the script again:

python firestore_upload_script.py
This corrected file path should resolve the FileNotFoundError and allow the script to find your service account credentials and proceed with initializing Firestore and uploading the Charter data!

Please update the script with the corrected key_path, rerun it, and let me know the output. I am confident this will fix the error and we'll see the Charter data upload proceed successfully this time!
